content:
ActiveDirectorySubnet Class

In this Article

The ActiveDirectorySubnet class represents a subnet in a Forest.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ActiveDirectorySubnet : IDisposable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ActiveDirectorySubnet

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Constructors summary

ActiveDirectorySubnet(DirectoryContext,String)

Initializes an instance of the ActiveDirectorySubnet class, using the specified DirectoryContext object and subnet name.
ActiveDirectorySubnet(DirectoryContext,String,String)

Initializes an instance of the ActiveDirectorySubnet class, using the specified DirectoryContext object, subnet name, and site name.

Properties summary

Location

Gets or sets the location description of the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.
Name

Gets the subnet name of the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.
Site

Gets or sets the site that the ActiveDirectorySubnet object is a member of.

Methods summary

Delete()

Deletes the subnet that is represented by this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.
Dispose()

Releases all resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.
Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySubnet object and optionally releases the managed resources.
FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

Returns a subnet that is based on a subnet name.
GetDirectoryEntry()

Gets the DirectoryEntry object for this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.
Save()

Writes any changes to the ActiveDirectorySubnet object to the Active Directory Domain Services store.
ToString()

Returns the name of the subnet.

Constructors

  • ActiveDirectorySubnet(DirectoryContext,String)

    Initializes an instance of the ActiveDirectorySubnet class, using the specified DirectoryContext object and subnet name.

    public ActiveDirectorySubnet (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string subnetName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that specifies the context for this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    • subnetName
      String

      A String that specifies the name of the subnet.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      context specifies a configuration set, but no AD LDS instance was found.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:

      • context does not refer a valid forest, configuration set, domain controller, or AD LDS server.

      • subnetName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or subnetName is null.

    • AuthenticationException

      The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

  • ActiveDirectorySubnet(DirectoryContext,String,String)

    Initializes an instance of the ActiveDirectorySubnet class, using the specified DirectoryContext object, subnet name, and site name.

    public ActiveDirectorySubnet (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string subnetName, string siteName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that specifies the context for this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    • subnetName
      String

      A String that specifies the name of the subnet.

    • siteName
      String

      A String that specifies the name of the site that contains the subnet.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      context specifies a configuration set, but no AD LDS instance was found.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:

      • context does not refer to a valid forest, configuration set, domain controller, or AD LDS server.

      • subnetName or siteName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context, subnetName, or siteName is null.

    • AuthenticationException

      The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

Properties

  • Location

    Gets or sets the location description of the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    public string Location { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The location description of the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Name

    Gets the subnet name of the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    public string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the subnet.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Site

    Gets or sets the site that the ActiveDirectorySubnet object is a member of.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySite Site { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ActiveDirectorySite

      An ActiveDirectorySite object for the site that the ActiveDirectorySubnet object is a member of.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      Applies to set only. The specified ActiveDirectorySite object does not exist. If it was newly created, it must be committed to the directory store before assigning it to the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

Methods

  • Delete()

    Deletes the subnet that is represented by this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    public void Delete ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ActiveDirectorySubnet object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    • UnauthorizedAccessException

      The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

  • Dispose()

    Releases all resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    public void Dispose ();
  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the ActiveDirectorySubnet object and optionally releases the managed resources.

    protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true if the managed resources should be released; false if only the unmanaged resources should be released.

  • FindByName(DirectoryContext,String)

    Returns a subnet that is based on a subnet name.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet FindByName (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string subnetName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that is valid for this subnet.

    • subnetName
      String

      The name of the subnet to find.

    Returns

    • ActiveDirectorySubnet

      An ActiveDirectorySubnet for the requested subnet.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      In the context parameter that was specified, the site could not be found for the given subnetName parameter.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ArgumentException

      This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:

      • The target in the context parameter is not a forest, configuration set, domain controller, or AD LDS server.

      • subnetName is an empty string.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or subnetName is null.

  • GetDirectoryEntry()

    Gets the DirectoryEntry object for this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    public System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry GetDirectoryEntry ();

    Returns

    • DirectoryEntry

      The DirectoryEntry object for this ActiveDirectorySubnet object.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ActiveDirectorySubnet object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

  • Save()

    Writes any changes to the ActiveDirectorySubnet object to the Active Directory Domain Services store.

    public void Save ();

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectExistsException

      The subnet object already exists.

    • ActiveDirectoryOperationException

      A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

    • ActiveDirectoryServerDownException

      The target server is either busy or unavailable.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.

    • UnauthorizedAccessException

      The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

  • ToString()

    Returns the name of the subnet.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String that represents the name of the subnet.

    Exceptions

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The object has been disposed.
